repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The papers consist of correspondence, mainly between members of the Leadbeater family, including Mary Leadbeater and her husband William, and the Shackleton family, including Mary Leadbeater's parents, Elizabeth and Richard Shackleton, her sister, Sarah, and her grandfather, Abraham Shackleton. There is also correspondence with many other relatives, including Mary's cousin, Margaret Pike. Many letters were written by children. There is extensive correspondence between Mary and the poet Melesina Trench. The papers also include poetry by Mary (including a poem written about Edmund Burke); narrative diaries kept by her mother, Elizabeth; manuscript magazines written by children; and a family tree.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of James Marshall and Marie-Louise Osborn.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Ballitore Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Ballitore Papers. Osborn Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced from a previously existing card set in the Manuscripts Catalog, or from another inventory. All pertinent bibliographical information has been retained. This list is subject to revision once final folder numbering and labeling have been completed. If this collection contains unlisted or unsorted material, this has been noted.

bioghist.head: Richard Shackleton
bioghist.p: Richard Shackleton succeeded his father, Abraham, as master of Ballitore School, a Quaker school that opened in 1726 in Ballitore, Ireland. One of Abraham's students had been Edmund Burke. Richard's second wife was Elizabeth Carleton, and Mary Shackleton Leadbeater was their daughter.

bioghist.head: Mary Shackleton Leadbeater
bioghist.p: Mary Shackleton Leadbeater married William Leadbeater (a former student at the Ballitore School) in 1791. They resided in Ballitore, where he was a farmer and landowner, and she ran the village post office. In 1794, she published anonymously "Extracts and Original Anecdotes for the Improvement of Youth." She also published "Poems" in 1808; "Cottage Dialogues among the Irish Peasantry" in 1811; and "Memoirs and Letters of Richard and Elizabeth Shackleton" in 1822. Her "Annals of Ballitore" was printed posthumously in 1862 by Richard Davis Webb as "The Leadbeater Papers."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of correspondence, mainly between members of the Leadbeater family, including Mary Shackleton Leadbeater and her husband William, and members of the Shackleton family. There is also correspondence with many other relatives, including Mary's cousin, Margaret Pike; a number of letters were written by children. There is extensive correspondence between Mary and the poet Melesina Trench. The papers also include poetry by Mary (including a poem written about Edmund Burke); narrative diaries kept by her mother, Elizabeth; manuscript magazines written by children; and a family tree.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into 1 series: I. Correspondence and Other Papers, 1709-1827.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Alphabetically arranged, with unsorted material at the end of the series.

The series contains mostly family correspondence, mainly between members of the Leadbeater family, including Mary Leadbeater and her husband William, and the Shackleton family, including Mary Leadbeater's parents, Elizabeth and Richard Shackleton, her sister, Sarah, and her grandfather, Abraham Shackleton. There is also correspondence with many other relatives, including Mary's cousin, Margaret Pike. Many letters were written by children.

Frequent topics of the correspondence include personal and family news, particularly of the heath of various family members; business matters; Ballitore School; Ireland; and literature and poetry. There is extensive correspondence between Mary and the poet Melesina Trench, in which the two women discuss literature and their writings.
The papers also include poetry by Mary, including a poem written about Edmund Burke; narrative diaries kept by her mother, Elizabeth; manuscript magazines written by children; and a family tree.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Detailed folder notes in the box and folder list highlight the main topics of many correspondents' letters.

scopecontent.p: Includes 5 letters from Deb[orah] Christy and 2 from Mary Christy. Letters are addressed to Richard Shackleton, Mary and William Leadbeater and Thomas Chandlee.

did.unittitle: Colles, Edward. ALS to Mary Leadbeater, Liverpool

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter discusses personal matters.

did.unittitle: Coote, Charles, d. 1770. 34 ALS to Mary Leadbeater, [v.p.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The letters discuss personal matters and include portions of Coote's verse, the inscription on the tomb of his daughter Mary Ann, and detail about the school he attended. The death of Charles, 4th Duke of Rutland, is mentioned, 1787 Oct 26, and problems of publishing one of Mary Leadbeater's books in London are discussed, 1812 Apr 16.

did.unittitle: Coote, Charles, 1761-1835. 2 ALS to an unnamed recipient, Dublin, [n.p.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters discuss personal matters, Mrs. Leadbeater's poems and the Ballitore School.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Anonymous manuscript. Mentions a cholera plague, politics, especially the "soap question", India, and family life.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters discuss personal matters. Included is an account of a duel; meeting of an American; and mention of Edmund Burke with a quote from him and on his stand towards slavery, 1783 Aug 6, 1789 May 30. Also postscripts by Abraham Shackleton, H[enry] Tuke and Sarah Shackleton are included.

Several postscripts by other family members are included, as well as poems by Sarah Shackelton and a letter written by Gustavius Vassa [Olaudah Equiano] to the Society of Friends thanking them for publishing A Caution to Gt. did.unittitle: Trench, Melesina (Chenevix), 1768-1827. ca. 300 ALS to Mary Leadbeater, [v.p.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Several letters from Melesina Trench's family are included; one notes the death of Melesina Trench. Letters discuss literary matters, especially concerning the works of Mary Leadbeater and Melesina Trench. Several poems are included throughout the letters.
